title: Going fishing
context: A man [A] and his wife meet a woman [B] on the road.

7.speaker: B
7.text: Are you going to be bathing?

11.speaker: A
11.text: We will catch some fish for dinner.

13.speaker: B
13.text: Is there a celebration in the village?

17.speaker: A
17.text: My wife had bought a chicken at the market the other day

16.speaker: A
16.text: We just need food for our family.

requires: needing OBLIQUE ROLE FOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

18.speaker: A
18.text: but our children ate it all already!

19.speaker: A
19.text: Now we have nothing left at home!

20.speaker: A
20.text: and we don't have enough money anymore.

21.speaker: A
21.text: We really have to go fishing today.

requires: having to AGENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
having to COMPLEMENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

23.speaker: B
23.text: I am sorry that you have no food left

requires: being sorry AGENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

24.speaker: B
24.text: I can help you my friends

requires: being able to AGENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
being able to COMPLEMENT REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

26.speaker: B
26.text: We have lots of vegetables from our garden.

requires: giving OBLIQUE ROLE FOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

32.speaker: A
32.text: You will give us some vegetables

requires: giving OBLIQUE ROLE TO REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
giving OBLIQUE ROLE FOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT

33.speaker: A
33.text: and we'll give you some fish

requires: giving OBLIQUE ROLE TO REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
giving OBLIQUE ROLE FOR REFERENCE TO CONCEPT
